segments.text: I see the woman drying that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not notice the water pouring over the sink like that?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, and she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like she’s in her own little world, completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s always this distracted or if today is just an off day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are going to get into trouble, and she won’t even realize it until it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she looks while everything around her is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just going to keep spreading, and she won’t do anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she might be the most unaware person I’ve ever seen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost funny how clueless she is, but it’s also kind of sad.
segments.speaker: PAR
